title: Persona - NVIDIA Generative AI Developer Contest
description: For NVIDIA's Generative AI developer contest, I created a project called Persona, which placed me among the top 10 projects for the contest. Peronsa integrates Large-Language-Models into Unreal Engine, to power dynamic and immersive dialogues for characters in video games.

title: Unreal Engine Game Development
description: I have always dreamt of developing video-games, with full creative control over the entire project. In the beginning of 2024, I started to learn game development as a hobby. I started with Unity, and eventually made my way to Unreal Engine, while working on various projects with the engines to build up my skills. I am picking up skills in everything from game mechanics and level/environement design, to sound design and writing. I am currently in the early stages of developing a large game project (more info to come).

title: Predictive Maintenance of Turbofan Engines Using Machine Learning Methodologies
description: For my Machine Learning course in University, I worked on a term project where I used Turbofan engine data provided by NASA, along with Machine Learning Libraries in Python (Tensorflow, Scikit Learn, etc), to create a Machine Learning model that can predict remaining useful life of turbofan engines, for the purpose of predictive maintenance. The prediction was done through the use of both Regression and Neural Network models. More specifically, Random Forest Regressor and LSTM models were used, and their accuracies were compared. It was determined that the LSTM model provides a better prediction with a lower RMSE compared to the regression model. This analysis helped understand how to use Machine Learning techniques to tackle the problem of predictive maintenance.
